sentences.sContent: The economy and outward appearance of the area have changed considerably.
sentences.sCn: 该地区的经济和面貌发生了很大的变化。

sentences.sContent: His clenched fist was the only outward sign of his anger.
sentences.sCn: 他那紧握的拳头是他内心愤怒的唯一外在表现。

sentences.sContent: Other poor countries looked outward, strengthening their ties to the economic superpowers.
sentences.sCn: 其他的穷国向外看，加强它们和经济大国的联系。

synos.tran: 向外的；外面的；公开的；外服的；肉体的
向外（等于outwards）；在外；显而易见地

phrases.pCn: 单程旅行；国外旅行；出航

words.tran: 外面的，外部的；远离中心的
最远的；最外面的；最高头的
出现；在外；出局；出声地；不流行地
远足；短途旅游；体育比赛

trans.tranCn: 向外的；外面的；公开的；外服的；肉体的
trans.tranOther: relating to how a person or situation seems to be, rather than how it really is

trans.tranCn: 向外（等于outwards）；在外；显而易见地
trans.tranOther: If you say that a person or a group of people, such as a government, looks outward, you mean that they turn their attention to another group that they are interested in or would like greater involvement with
